page.title: 03BADDESLEY CLINTON MANOR -2-
page.content:
In 1980 the{National Trust}took over the manor house, and opened it to the public in{1982.}It is now in very good condition, thanks to the Trust itself and the help of two very generous local donors who gave an {endowment}of Â£300,000.
The house is still{furnished}as it was when the Ferrers family lived there,and therefore it gives an excellent idea of what life used to be like in a small country house. It is as though the family had gone out for a while.
It costs Â£1.40 to visit the house,and about{44,000 people}do so each year, mainly by car. This is a very good number for a small and rather remote National Trust property.
